title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 March 2014 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Sidali> has quit  
10:12 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <UCC> has quit  
10:38 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <ClemensR> legacy is with b/w compat classes; you get it if you compile with -Plegacy  
11:03 <ClemensR> some translations look a bit odd on l10n, e.g. http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Commons/xwiki-commons-extension-api?action=viewall&language=de  
11:03 <ClemensR> actually not the translations but the original text .... so far I have not looked where the velocity code comes from  
11:23 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <vmassol> evalica: "Currently (5.4.2) if your extension point does not also contain an object of type Panels.PanelClass, you still need to manually declare the extension point page in the 'Administration - Page Elements - Panels' area."  
11:45 <vmassol> I don't think this is correct  
11:45 <vmassol> the list of panels to display is always controlled by the Left/Right Panel list from the admin  
11:46 <vmassol> and that's not just currently, there's no other proposal that I know of  
11:47 <zenzla> is now known as <sbaloul>  
11:49 <evalica> vmassol: for example the Navigation Menu - it uses the extension point, but because is not packed as a panel, it is not automatically added. You need to put it manually  
11:49 <vmassol> that's true for ALL panels  
11:50 <evalica> that's because is not a panel. All panels are correctly displayed  
11:50 <vmassol> there's no exception  
11:50 <evalica> Navigation Menu is not a panel. Is a wiki page that uses the extension point.  
11:50 <vmassol> panels are NEVER automatically added  
11:50 <evalica> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10112  
11:51 <vmassol> I don't understand your issue but it has nothing to do with the panel UIX  
11:51 <evalica> vmassol: if you can rewrite the warning … to make it more clear.. or I don't know.  
11:51 <evalica> well… an user might think that all they need to do is to give the extension point … and it will magically appaear in the Panels zone. It is not trye  
11:51 <vmassol> this is related to the menu feature, nothing to do with panels and UIX  
11:52 <vmassol> again nothing to do with UIX and panes  
11:52 <vmassol> \*panels  
11:52 <evalica> ok I will remove the warning  
11:52 <vmassol> you can put this warning in the menu application if you wish  
11:52 <vmassol> but not in UIX  
11:52 <vmassol> (Menu app documentation that is)  
11:53 <evalica> for the Menu app, it is already documented  
11:53 <vmassol> actually the screenshots are a bit misleading for left/right panels uix  
11:54 <vmassol> the screenshots show a single panel being surrounded by a red border  
11:54 <vmassol> it's actually the full zone that should be surrounded  
11:54 <vmassol> not just a single panel  
11:54 <vmassol> so a screenshot with 2 panels would be a bit less misleading IMO  
11:54 <vmassol> (and the red border showing that it's around the whole thing)  
11:54 <vmassol> the UIX is for the whole area  
11:55 <vmassol> also "This Extension Point is contributed as a template (rightpanels.vm) in version  4.3-milestone-1 of XWiki." I think I would phrase it differently: "This extension point is used in a panel (rightpanels.vm) and was introduced in XWiki 4.3"  
11:56 <vmassol> the doc should also mention that the extension point uses the configuration params for listing left and right panels  
11:56 <vmassol> to decide what panels to display  
11:57 <vmassol> "leftPanels" and "rightPanels" defined in the xclass inside XWiki.XWikiPrefrrences  
11:57 <vmassol> (and configurable through the admin )  
11:58 <vmassol> sorry for all the comments and thanks for taking up the documentation of this! :)  
11:59 <evalica> vmassol: the This Extension Point is contributed as a template (rightpanels.vm) in version  4.3-milestone-1 of XWiki. is generated by the UIX app  
11:59 <evalica> I took the example from the other entries  
11:59 <vmassol> wdym?  
11:59 <vmassol> the prhasing looks wrong  
11:59 <vmassol> or at least misleading  
11:59 <evalica> 'Introduced in version' and 'Extension contributing this Extension Point' fields  
11:59 <vmassol> for me contribute = implementation of an UIX  
12:00 <vmassol> you contribute an impl of a UIX  
12:00 <vmassol> but a UIX is used in a certain place  
12:00 <vmassol> we need to standardize our vocabulary on this, I think we're doing poor ATM  
12:00 <vmassol> I'm open to suggestions but we need to make it clear  
12:00 <vmassol> - who is defining the UIX, i.e. where it's used  
12:01 <evalica> the model was this http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/AfterHeaderUIX  
12:01 <vmassol> actually where it's used depends on the skin  
12:01 <vmassol> so we may not want to document that  
12:01 <vmassol> - what we call those implementing the UIX  
12:02 <vmassol> @evalica: which proves that what I wrote wasn't good :) At least I don't understand it in the same way now  
12:03 <vmassol> we need a common vocabulary

16:04 <rk\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <rk\_> re  
16:09 <rk\_> Hi everyone! I'm looking for a way to custom map a dblist property using hibernate. I've so far managed to map a class consisting of noncomplex properties using the tutorial found on the xwiki documentation site but i fail to find any further reading material... Any help would be greatly appreciated!  
16:23 <Denis> has quit  
16:25 <Sidali> has quit  
16:31 <vishnu93> has joined #xwiki  
16:32 <vishnu93> has left #xwiki  
16:41 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
16:54 <cjd> has quit  
17:04 <rk\_> has quit  
17:04 <spu7inc> has joined #xwiki  
17:15 <Sidali> has quit  
17:16 <spu7inc> Hello :)  
17:17 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
17:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:34 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <spu7inc> Does someone know, if there is a possibility to automatically update page xmls on a running instance, if you are editing them with IntelliJ?  
17:38 <vmassol> spu7inc: you can import them through a REST API yes  
17:38 <spu7inc> by script? or is there already a maven plugin / intellij plugin which does the job?  
17:39 <vmassol> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43M2#HRESTAPIImprovements  
17:39 <vmassol> there's no intellij plugin yet, that would be awesome to have!  
17:39 <vmassol> someone who knows who to write an intelli plugin could do that very easily  
17:39 <vmassol> the xwiki part is really simple  
17:39 <vmassol> just a POST to the right URL and you're done  
17:40 <vmassol> actually just a POST to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI#HPageresources is enough, no need to import a XAT  
17:40 <vmassol> \*XAR  
17:40 <vmassol> s/POST/PUT  
17:41 <spu7inc> Thx alot >)  
17:41 <vmassol> what exists is XEclipse which does this but based on Eclipse RCP  
17:42 <spu7inc> I am not really into eclipse ;)  
17:42 <vmassol> it can be used standalone  
17:43 <vmassol> (no need to have eclipse)  
17:43 <vmassol> however it's not been maintained for a while but I know Ludovic improved it not long ago but he's not released his changes unfortunately  
17:43 <vmassol> (can't seem on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Eclipse+Downloads )  
17:44 <vmassol> (but it can be built from sources easily though, https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-eclipse )  
17:44 <spu7inc> Hmm, which project do I have to clone, when I want to start adding functionality to xwiki? platform or enterprise?  
17:44 <vmassol> depends what you're changing  
17:44 <vmassol> but  
17:44 <vmassol> there' s information here:  
17:45 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository  
17:45 <vmassol> (maybe not enough for you though)  
17:45 <vmassol> tell us more what you wish to do!  
17:46 <spu7inc> I am in the unfortunate situation, that I have to take over a project from one of my former co-workers  
17:46 <vmassol> thanks mflorea for https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4c2da3bf843b87574d89da5fc7d1dc81ef94fe4f#commitcomment-5545358  
17:46 <vmassol> checking now  
17:46 <spu7inc> And he did not really do a nice job  
17:47 <vmassol> spu7inc: interesting challenge indeed :)  
17:47 <vmassol> what has he done on the xwiki side?  
17:47 <spu7inc> He "bypassed" the xwiki way to store data by utilizing a sql plugin  
17:47 <spu7inc> instead of custom mapping  
17:47 <vmassol> indeed, that's not very nice  
17:48 <spu7inc> He did all his dev-work inside the browser editor and left quite a mess ^^  
17:48 <vmassol> you mean he didn't save his work under a SCM?  
17:49 <spu7inc> Indeed >)  
17:49 <vmassol> naughty… :)  
17:49 <vmassol> FYI in case you don't know, we have 2 extensions to sync with a SCM  
17:49 <vmassol> one for subversion and one for git  
17:49 <vmassol> that makes it easy to push/pull changes  
17:50 <vmassol> (for git: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/GitHubApp )  
17:50 <vmassol> (github actually, not git)  
17:50 <spu7inc> So you can basically edit your stuff and it will be automatically pushed into your instance?  
17:50 <spu7inc> Lovely :)  
17:52 <spu7inc> So, if you want to get all the modules required for code completion within Velocity files, does this mean I should clone platform, or enterprise?  
17:52 <vmassol> in the xwiki dev team, we don't use it though, we just export pages in XML format and use our custom maven XAR plugin to create XARs but this app looks nice  
17:52 <vmassol> code completion? you mean http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/AutoCompletion+Application ?  
17:53 <vmassol> or do you mean code completion in your IDE?  
17:53 <spu7inc> I did :)  
17:53 <vmassol> enterpise is jus the distribution  
17:53 <vmassol> \*enterprise  
17:53 <vmassol> \*just  
17:54 <vmassol> the real code  is in commons, rendering and platform  
17:54 <vmassol> clone platform and you should be fine  
17:54 <spu7inc> Perfect >)  
17:55 <vmassol> sbaloul: great, your first reply on the list! :)  
17:55 <Sidali> has quit  
17:55 <sbaloul> Yes, i thought that I have the answer  
17:55 <sbaloul> :)  
17:56 <vmassol> cool  
17:56 <sbaloul> I hope that helps the guy  
17:56 <vmassol> it should, let's see what he says :)  
17:57 <sbaloul> Ok :)  
17:58 <vmassol> mflorea: it's interesting since it means we've had this bug for some time now  
17:58 <vmassol> (referring to getDefaultEditMode)  
17:58 <vmassol> I'm creating a separate jira for it  
17:58 <vmassol> (since 3.4M1 to be precise)  
17:59 <mflorea> well, all old pages were still using the 'document' parameter  
17:59 <vmassol> sure but someone could have used document=  
17:59 <vmassol> s/document/reference  
17:59 <mflorea> indeed  
18:00 <vmassol> this code is a bit hackish… would need to find the right way to code it but not right now...  
18:01 <mflorea> the quick fix is to check the reference parameter besides the 'document'  
18:01 <vmassol> yep  
18:01 <vmassol> that's what I'm doing now  
18:02 <mflorea> I'm not sure it's worth refactoring the code, it may be dangerous too, This code is for the old sheet mechanism anyway. If you use document sheet binding then you don't care  
18:02 <vmassol> indeed, we'll just need to find a way to move it to legacy  
18:03 <mflorea> yeah, that's not easy  
18:09 <vmassol> I hesitated writing a unit tests since it's some legacy code we wish to remove...  
18:11 <spu7inc> vmassol: What tools do you use internally for developing xwiki-pages?  
18:11 <vmassol> we write them in a local xwiki instance and then export the page and then commit it in git  
18:12 <vmassol> then use mvn xar:format to format the page  
18:12 <vmassol> fyi our XAR plugin is documented here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XARPlugin  
18:12 <spu7inc> thx :)  
18:13 <vmassol> mflorea: ok to merge https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f8e57df06de241cff9896d24ecd5e21f0c8640d0 on the 5.4 branch?  
18:14 <mflorea> vmassol: +1  
18:14 <vmassol> ok thanks  
18:18 <vmassol> actually there's an indirect test, the scheduler one ;)  
18:18 <vmassol> let's see if it passes now  
18:18 <mflorea> yep, it should pass now  
18:19 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
18:21 <vmassol> reminder: 6.0M1 is planned for next Monday… :)  
18:22 <vmassol> will be a small content release…  
18:22 <vmassol> which is normal since we've worked a lot on finishing the 5.4.x releases  
18:26 <spu7inc> brb :)  
18:26 <spu7inc> has quit
